title.narrative: GUY 2.3 CHILD PROTECTION INTERVENTIONS

description.narrative: Enhanced national capacity in the development and implementation of evidence based child protection programmes with attention to areas of disparities,which contributes to Access To Justice, Child Protection Systems, Child Protection â€“ General, Child Protection â€“ Strengthen Families And Communities, Justice For Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2016, Guyana and Suriname have completed implementation of respective evidence-based and equity and gender-sensitive programmes of action to achieve the MD/MDGs targets on survival and development, protection, and participation for boys, girls, and women in the general population and in the hinterland and rural areas of Guyana and in the interior of Suriname AND both countries are implementing a post MD/MDGs target date (2015) programme of action for achievement of continuing progress in the survival, development, protection, and participation of children and women with equity based on CRC and CEDAW principles.

Technical assistance - Prevention and response services for violence against children

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Enhanced national capacity in the development and implementation of evidence based child protection programmes with attention to areas of disparities

description.narrative: In the area of a child protection the country focused on capacity development of service providers especially through partnering with tertiary education institutions to develop masters programme focusing on child protection services (social work, and psychology). | Status:Met | As-of Date:11/01/2017

title.narrative: # of community care points providing minimum package of gender sensitive and human rights-based care

baseline.value: 30 community care points with weak capacity

title.narrative: Children placed in foster homes or adopted, in line with UN Guidelines for the Alternative Care of Children

baseline.value: About 600 children currently in child care institutions

title.narrative: Revised pre-service Social Welfare curriculum includes intensive counseling skills development

baseline.value: Counseling Training restricted to only two semesters of Social Welfare programme

title.narrative: Functional family court in place, in line with CRC

baseline.value: Family court currently not adequately functional as per standards

title.narrative: Coverage of Juvenile Justice services as per international instruments
Regions having a functioning Women and Child Protection Centre

baseline.value: No Women and Child Protection Centres

title.narrative: Target Social Workers trained in intensive counseling skills
